intro: Selago thyrsoidea var. thyrsoidea, commonly known as the narrowleaf selago, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in wetlands. It has slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps.
